content.content: Password Security: Your First Line of Defense

Passwords are the gatekeepers of your digital identity. Whether it’s your email, work applications, or company systems, a strong password is often the only thing standing between sensitive data and a cybercriminal. Here's what you need to know to stay protected:

Reusing the same password across multiple sites makes you vulnerable. If one site is breached, attackers may try the same credentials elsewhere (a tactic called “credential stuffing”).

MFA adds a second layer of protection, usually requiring a code from your phone or a biometric check. This makes it significantly harder for attackers to gain access even if your password is compromised.
Remember: Cybersecurity starts with you. A strong password is one of the simplest, most effective tools you have to protect yourself and your organization.
